column1: # Regional feed energy requirements per unit of animal product output

column2: S. (2000). Human Use of Land and Organic Materials:

column1: # Modeling the Turnover of Biomass in the Global Food System.
# Chalmers University of Technology and GÃ¶teborg University
# Estimated feed energy requirements to produce one unit of animal product output.
# Values calculated from productivity estimates in Wirsenius (2000) Table 3.8.
# Regional variation reflects differences in production systems
# - NE_l: Net energy for lactation (MJ per kg product) - dairy production
# - NE_m: Net energy for maintenance (MJ per kg product) - basic metabolism
# - NE_g: Net energy for growth (MJ per kg product) - body mass gain
# - ME: Metabolizable energy (MJ per kg product) - for monogastrics
# Animal products mapped to model categories:
# - "dairy" includes cattle milk production (with carcass as byproduct)
# - "meat-cattle" includes dedicated beef production from beef breeds
# - "eggs" includes egg production (with hen carcass as byproduct)
# Note: The original table included "Dairy bulls & heifers carcass" which is
# excluded here as it represents a byproduct flow already captured in dairy systems.
